noItems: You haven't added a registry. To add a new one, click 'Add' on the top right.

tips.common: Registries contain the images you can select to use in your Projects and Versions.
tips.v2: Here you can add Docker API V2 compatible registries.
tips.hub: Here you're able to add public or private Docker Hub registries.
tips.unchecked: Add a registry without authentication. This type does not provide image nor tag browsing.
tips.learnMorePat: Learn more about personal access token
tips.githubTokenReason: Github allows downloads, while access to the complete listing of all tags requires authentication, which we extensively utilize.

errors.preconditionFailed: This registry is already in use
errors.invalidArgument: Registry with the given URL does not exist

registryAlreadyInUse: This registry is already in use. Modifying the url or the credentials may break existing deployments.
toRecivieNotifications: To receive notifications of image push and pulls, you need to create a registry token.
tokenIsReady: The registry token is ready. Make sure to copy the token itself or the enivironments below now. You won't be able to see them again!
toUseTheTokenInV2: To use your token in a v2 compatible registry, you have to copy settings into your registry's config file.
readMoreAboutV2: You can read more about v2 registries in the distribution project's documentation.
